metadata.Title: CVE-2018-14663 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description: An issue has been found in PowerDNS DNSDist before 1.3.3 allowing a remote attacker to craft a DNS query with trailing data such that the addition of a record by dnsdist, for example an OPT record when adding EDNS Client Subnet, might result in the trailing data being smuggled to the backend as a valid record while not seen by dnsdist. This is an issue when dnsdist is deployed as a DNS Firewall and used to filter some records that should not be received by the backend. This issue occurs only when either the 'useClientSubnet' or the experimental 'addXPF' parameters are used when declaring a new backend.

criterions.comment: dnsdist: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
